concept.title: DTD: Coding requirements for expansion modules
concept.shortdesc: An expansion module defines the expanded configuration for a map or topic element type.

section.title: Expansion modules
section.p: Expansion modules have the following coding requirements:

dd.p: The tagname.attributes parameter entity declares the expanded attributes.
This parameter entity can be defined in an attribute specialization module, or it can be defined directly in the expansion module.

example.p: For example, the following parameter entity defines a new attribute intended for use with various table elements:
example.codeblock: <!ENTITY % cellPurposeAtt-d-attribute-expansion "cell-purpose (sale | out-of-stock | new | last-chance | inherit | none) #IMPLIED" >

dd.p: Note that the name of the parameter entity ends with -expansion; this indicates that this is an expansion attribute and should not be included in the base-attribute-extensions entity in the document-type shell.

The tagname.content parameter entity declares the expanded content model for the element. This redefinition of the content model references the parameter entity that was defined in the element specialization module.
